content: the weekend shawl materials i used 3 x 200g elle colour crush 600m each dk weight 100% acrylic made a plus size shawl 6mm and 4 5mm hook you will need yarn of choice and a hook 2 sizes bigger than the ball band requires tapestry needle scissors for this quick and easy beginner friendly pattern you will only need to know single_crochet stitches double_crochet front and back post double_crochet and back loop only us terms used abbreviations and stitches single_crochet single_crochet increase increase repeat sequence repeat seq chain chain double_crochet double_crochet back loop only blo front post double_crochet fpdc back post double_crochet bpdc turn - t special notes please note all the odd/uneven row are double_crochet back loop only and the stitch count will remain the same as the previous single_crochet increase row so therefore i will not be noting them in the short hand written pattern please watch the short tutorial along with this written pattern as the increases only occur in the single_crochet row but you will need to alternate the starts of these row to be sure that your shawl is worked up evenly and consistently into a crescent moon shape you also have the option of not doing back loop only double_crochet it will not alter the stitchwork only the overall look and feel of the shawl so if you don t like the textured lines that the back loop only stitches make you can just do normal double_crochet instead please enjoy with your 6mm hook make a magic_ring or chain 5 and slip_stitch into the 1st chain to form a ring row 1 12 double_crochet
